alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Mecklenburg (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 5:54PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Mecklenburg and southwestern Brunswick Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 553 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Chase City to near Clarksville. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... South Hill around 620 PM EDT. La Crosse around 625 PM EDT. Brodnax around 630 PM EDT. Ebony around 640 PM EDT. Gasburg around 645 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Nelson, Beechwood, Bowens Corner, John H Kerr Dam, North View, Finchley, White Plains, Valentines, Skipwith and Rogers Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
